intro: Gastrochilus raraensis, commonly known as the rare orchid of the Hengduan Mountains, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid forest environments. The plant features a slender, upright stem with a few leaves and produces delicate, pale green to white flowers. It is characterized by its unique morphology and is found in specific regions of China. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
